channel.title: Little Idea I have
channel.description:
I'm currently working on a source. I was thinking of an idea to make a good server. I was thinking of making it economy but with a little twist. You'll start of in a location and you'll have to start by earning cash by doing skilling things (Theiving will be hard) and once you make a certain amount of cash, you can pay staff ingame to be ranked up. Ranking up will allow you to start killing monsters and gaining more skills instead of doing skilling.
Each rank will contain different things.

item.title: Little Idea I have
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:17, topic:551986”]The OP already suggested that you had to “unlock” the land.

On runescape you don’t have access to 90% of the dragon gear until you unlock it via quests.
You don’t even have access to rune platebodies until you do a quest…
And lets not even mention the requirements to get into the new elf city.

I was just suggesting another alternative.[/quote]
we’re taking about servers tho

Read full topic

item.title: Little Idea I have
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

That’s a better idea, have unlocks be decided by quest, not bribing staff members with gp.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

arham 4:

I just wanna play a server man not go through some complicated “unlock land” stuff.

The OP already suggested that you had to “unlock” the land.

On runescape you don’t have access to 90% of the dragon gear until you unlock it via quests.
You don’t even have access to rune platebodies until you do a quest…
And lets not even mention the requirements to get into the new elf city.

I was just suggesting another alternative.

item.title: Little Idea I have
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:551986”]As everyone is pointing out, there should be a system in place (perhaps npcs) that makes it so you don’t need to talk to staff to rank up.
Reason being:

  1. What if no staff is online? Will I be forever stuck thieving?
  2. What if the staff gets mad for no apparent reason and revokes my rank?
  3. What if a staff member “scam quits” by de-ranking everyone possible?
  4. What if a staff will not rank me because they “don’t like me”?

Also, I don’t like this being the core concept of the overall server. While some players will find it cool and ‘enjoyable’ I can guaranty others will not.
Maybe if it was part of the server, but not the core feature.
Lets say you had to get 50 thieving and 1 million gp to unlock taverly…
And then you had to get 500k while inside of taverly to gain access to the stores. Another 250k for access to their dungeon. Etc
That would be something people would like - depending on the economy of the server, and of course, what was featured inside the areas.[/quote]
I just wanna play a server man not go through some complicated “unlock land” stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Little Idea I have
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

As everyone is pointing out, there should be a system in place (perhaps npcs) that makes it so you don’t need to talk to staff to rank up.
Reason being:

  1. What if no staff is online? Will I be forever stuck thieving?
  2. What if the staff gets mad for no apparent reason and revokes my rank?
  3. What if a staff member “scam quits” by de-ranking everyone possible?
  4. What if a staff will not rank me because they “don’t like me”?

Also, I don’t like this being the core concept of the overall server. While some players will find it cool and ‘enjoyable’ I can guaranty others will not.
Maybe if it was part of the server, but not the core feature.
Lets say you had to get 50 thieving and 1 million gp to unlock taverly…
And then you had to get 500k while inside of taverly to gain access to the stores. Another 250k for access to their dungeon. Etc
That would be something people would like - depending on the economy of the server, and of course, what was featured inside the areas.

Read full topic

Just Creative:

you can pay staff ingame to be ranked up.

The flaw in this game. I don’t want to put so much work on the staff.

item.title: Little Idea I have
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Welliton_inc, post:9, topic:551986”][quote author=Pest link=topic=670903.msg4486622#msg4486622 date=1434365827]

dumb idea, sorry

[/quote]

It is not a dumb idea… It is a flawed idea which can be improved. All he would need to do to make the concept a little more long-term would be to make it so you don’t need to communicate with staff members in order to continue & change the way in which you progress aswell. As in finding a new way which can be seen as “progression”.

Atleast he is thinking of ways in which he can make a server that can be regarded as unique. 99% of the trash posted nowadays is just some PI leech that only focuses on PVP.[/quote]

would not play

Read full topic

item.title: Little Idea I have
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

The whole idea of ranking up just doesn’t fit to me. If you’re using it as a feature to just make it longer to max out or finish the fame, then just make it more difficult to gain experience + items/whatever in the first place.

Read full topic

item.title: Little Idea I have
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Justin Bieber, post:3, topic:551986”]Also, I don’t know how other people feel about this but personally I really dislike having to interact with community staff since they’re usually kids with a pumped up sense of authority.[/quote]Sadly accurate to some extent.

item.title: Little Idea I have
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

It is interesting, but what happens when you unlocked everything? It sort of sounds like a quest-type sort of server. These servers are fun whilst there is unexplored content but once you’ve completed everything players quit.

If I were you, i’d make it sort of like a slayer-esk type of server. You talk to some guy who provides you with a task to do (skilling, killing a certain monster, pk people etc) and the player must do these tasks in order to maybe level up, receive an item, receive a perk (double xp for 1 day) etc etc. That way people will always have something to do and the server concept is more long-term.

It is good to see you atleast thinking of unique concepts other than the crap being “made” as we speak.

Read full topic
